data.value: Client Obsession
Slide to the left or right to select a sentence describing your most likely behaviour.
Client first. Look for solutions to improve client satisfaction and service perception
I make decisions without considering clients’ wishes and/or exploring their needs and/or do not consider the perception/reputation generated.
I place the client at the heart of all decisions (example: ‘What does my client want?’). I ask open questions and work on solutions that aim at exceeding their expectations.
I anticipate clients’ needs and requests by developing rapport and proximity. I work on solutions to shape an exceptional service perception (example: availability of our creations, follow up, ...).
I do not know.
Contribute to create unique client experiences
I miss the opportunity to consider every client touchpoint and/or interaction as an opportunity to shape the Maison's reputation and/or do the minimum required to serve them.
I follow the Maison's ceremonial and design experiences that consolidate its ‘exclusivity’ reputation.
I enter the clients' universe and walk them through a unique journey by creating targeted experiences.
I do not know.
Act as an ambassador of the maison and display pride in its heritage and expertise in craftsmanship

I miss the opportunity to share the Maison's stories to engage the client on the ‘why’ and/or do not transmit a strong sense of pride, resulting in a poor client understanding of the value proposition.

I share tangible and intangible elements (example: storytelling, company foundational heritage stories, ...) and display. I pass on a strong sense of pride for the Maison's heritage and expertise in craftsmanship.

I develop a consolidated perception of the uniqueness and exclusivity of the Maison. I co-develop story telling with clients and share it (example: I make sure clients can speak about the Maison to others, collects testimonials, input, ...).
I do not know
Deliver what you promised
I miss the opportunity to deliver what was promised to the client and/or change the course of actions/engagement taken, affecting them without anticipating the consequences.
I remove all barriers to deliver what was promised to the client or identify alternatives to ensure their full satisfaction.
I engage clients in a dialogue to define what can be delivered. I deliver what was promised and surprise the client with ‘extra mile’ actions.
I do not know.
Leverage data to anticipate clients' needs and maesure the implications of your decisions
I miss the opportunity to leverage data when making decisions affecting clients or collect too much data but do not use it to identify trends and patterns to act upon.
I leverage data and anticipate the implications of decisions on clients' habits, trends, desires.

I make sound decisions combining intuition, experience and data results. I leverage data (example: trends and patterns) to scope clients’ questions and needs and I promptly address clients’ expectations and/or anticipate market trends.
I do not know.
